title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees in the series opener at Fenway Park, managing only two hits.
Red Sox players Roman Anthony and Wilyer Abreu were absent, impacting the team's offensive performance.
Boston's defensive struggles included three errors and catcher Carlos Narvaez's league-leading sixth interference call.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending left quad injury during Week 2 Thursday Night Football against Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, sustained the injury attempting to block an extra point and will require surgery, according to ESPN.
Former Patriots DE signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Washington Commanders in March 2025.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start for the Red Sox against the Athletics next week at Fenway Park.
Manager Alex Cora is considering Early as a candidate for Tuesday's series opener at Fenway Park.
The Red Sox are evaluating their pitching options, including prospects Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on his contract opt-out during the offseason.
Bregman has a three-year, $120 million contract with opt-out options after 2025 and 2026.
Despite injury setbacks, Bregman has contributed significantly to the Red Sox's leadership and performance.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "Misery" (1990) is now available on HBO Max, featuring Kathy Bates' Oscar-winning performance as Annie Wilkes.
"This Is Spinal Tap" (1984), a mockumentary classic, is streaming on Xumo ahead of its new sequel release.
"Only Murders in the Building" Season 5, starring Steve Martin, Martin Short, and Selena Gomez, streams on Hulu.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White will miss the Patriots vs. Dolphins game due to injuries.
Head coach Mike Vrabel withheld updates on Gonzalez's recovery, but mentioned his ongoing improvement and readiness efforts.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and offensive tackle Morgan Moses are listed as questionable for Sunday's game in Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins, substituting for Terrell Williams.
Williams is temporarily away from the Patriots due to a health issue unrelated to his previous health scare.
Kuhr, in his first season as the Patriots' inside linebackers coach, previously filled in as playcaller during Williams's offseason absence.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty to federal fraud charges just weeks before her trial in Boston.
Cannon-Grant and her late husband Clark Grant allegedly defrauded donors of their nonprofit Violence in Boston.
Charges include wire fraud, mail fraud, and tax violations; Cannon-Grant could face decades in prison if convicted.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested on suspicion of shooting Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University in Utah.
Robinson is a third-year electrical apprenticeship student and previously attended Utah State on a scholarship.
Family noted Robinson became more political recently, viewing Kirk as spreading hate, according to officials.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox and Yankees are competing for the top AL wild-card spot in a pivotal series at Fenway Park.
Boston leads the season series 8-2 against the Yankees, with strong performances from pitchers Bello and Crochet.
Yankees' reliance on home runs continues as they lead MLB with 249 homers, crucial for their success against Boston.
